pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:0.5_0: The training rule on drinking alcohol
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were licking their lips while eating. ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:1.3.1_0: “‘I will not lick my lips,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:1.4_0: he should not eat licking his lips.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:1.5_0: If a monk, out of disrespect, licks his lips while eating, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:1.7.1_0: or it has not been trusted ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk54:1.9_0: The fourth rule, the training rule on fire, is finished.
